title: 📊 Market Intel — Feb 17 2026 12:00 PM
content:
# 📊 Market Intel — Tuesday, Feb 17, 2026 12:00 PM ET

**Top Headlines: Software Stocks Plunge Dragging BTC Below $67K | Masimo +34% Leads Gainers | Gold Drops 3% | Gemini Execs Depart Post-IPO | eToro Jumps 14% on Record Earnings | CFTC Defends Prediction Markets Jurisdiction**

---

## 🔥 Top Trending

- **Software stocks continue to plunge** — iShares Tech-Software ETF down another 3% on Tuesday, dragging broader tech sentiment. Nasdaq flat (+0.00%) while Dow ekes out +0.14%
- **Masimo (MASI) explodes +34%** — biggest gainer of the day at $174.80, massive volume (9.2M vs 751K avg)
- **Bitcoin slips below $67,000** — BTC at $67,659, correlated with software stock weakness. Down 28% from 52-week high of $126K
- **Gold plummets nearly 3%** — $4,897/oz, silver down 5.7%, commodities selling off hard
- **Gemini stock -10%** after parting ways with COO, CFO, and Chief Legal Officer months after IPO

---

### Crypto Headlines (CoinDesk)
- **Bitcoin below $67K** as software stocks plunge — most important BTC indicator right now is the iShares Tech-Software ETF, down 3%
- **Gemini stock -10%** — COO Marshall Beard, CFO Dan Chen, and CLO Tyler Meade departing effective immediately. Cameron Winklevoss taking COO duties
- **eToro shares +14%** — record Q4 profit despite crypto revenue drop, outperforming peers Robinhood and Coinbase
- **BitGo potential acquisition target** — Compass Point and Canaccord defend stock, cite institutional crypto infrastructure growth
- **Nakamoto to acquire BTC Inc & UTXO** in $107M all-stock deal — concerns about dilution
- **CFTC Chairman Selig** fires legal warning defending jurisdiction over prediction markets against states
